pageContext.claim: “Before you'd get separated so people would say let's not go up. Now you don't get separated and, you know, while that sounds nice and all, what happens is you have -- literally you have 10 times more families coming up because they're not going to be separated from their children.”
pageContext.analysis: Border apprehensions have increased but it's not clear that it's linked to the end of the family separation policy. Most migrants are fleeing gang violence in Central America. The number of migrants crossing the southern border has increased dramatically -- but by about 5 times, not 10.
